title: Direct Talk
subTitle: Enami Noriyuki won the coveted Double Gold Award at the world's most prestigious marmalade-making competition in 2020 and 2022. He talks about the secrets of his craft and his tumultuous journey.

title: The Seasons of Yamato
subTitle: A series of poetic videos by Koichi Hozan, a videographer living in Nara, in collaboration with a pianist, Mine Kawakami, for which she plays exclusive pieces, makes you experience each seasons.

title: Mice Media: Lessons in Internet Literacy
subTitle: The father posts a video online, spreading misinformation that the latest earthquake was man-made, unaware the information he received was fake.

title: NHK World Japan
subTitle: Discover story behind the 36 Views of Mt. Fuji woodprint series; The Great Wave off Kanagawa by Hokusai. It is not just a huge wave and Mt. Fuji, the boat caught in the wave have a reason.

title: Today's Close-Up
subTitle: The devices we use every day may carry hidden safety risks. Fires starting from electronics with lithium-ion batteries are increasingly common. What causes these accidents and how can we prevent them?

title: Seasoning the Seasons
subTitle: Visiting places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history. This time, taking a railway trip to the seaside town of Choshi.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
subTitle: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

title: Herbal Symphony
subTitle: As spring arrives, Japan's oldest private herb garden in Uda, Nara Prefecture, bursts into life. We follow the story of the people who walk on the footsteps of their ancestors to preserve these herbs.

title: Medical Frontiers
subTitle: A Japanese research team, focusing on the fact that people briefly wake up multiple times during sleep, help develop a device to prevent insomnia.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Cinematic Journey
subTitle: On a cinematic journey through Nagano, Daniel Moore explores the southern region's stunning landscapes in springtime.

title: Ramen Japan
subTitle: Experts talk about the history and diversity of ramen made in the Niigata Prefecture, one of Japan's foremost ramen hotspots.

title: Where We Call Home
subTitle: The crew visit Toyama to meet French pastry chef Josselin Rimbod, who creates uniquely colourful macarons with local ingredients, before going to Bibai, Hokkaido, to meet German-born Peter Steeger, who runs an airfield there.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Biz Stream Special Edition
subTitle: Explores innovative storage-based business models in Japan, from unique hotels to multipurpose lockers.

title: One in Every Japanese
subTitle: One in 30 Japanese suffer from mental illness. Following a woman who finds it hard to do simple tasks due to her illness, as she goes to rehabilitation for returning to work.

title: Activate Your Japanese
subTitle: Rei's bento menu for the hotel's autumn campaign was passed over. Xuan wants to cheer him up and asks him if he can come and help with the summer festival. But Rei is completely oblivious of the fact that Xuan has asked him to do something.

title: Culture Crossroads
subTitle: The fact that Japan is very dry in winter greatly increases the risk of fire. We learn tips for preventing fires occurring and how to respond effectively when a fire breaks out.

title: Hello! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
subTitle: We intorduce the contents and activities of NHK WORLD-JAPAN to make the station and programs known to more people all over the world. This is the window of the station to the world.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
subTitle: Located in an isolated part of the Pacific, the Ogasawara Islands are home to many unique species of both flora and fauna. Their interconnected cycle of life is supported by efforts to control invasive species that threaten their delicate balance.

title: On the Wings
subTitle: Presents scenic aerial views of coral reef islands from a passenger jet heading from Tokyo Haneda to New Ishigaki Airport.

title: Hometown Stories
subTitle: Explores a farm supporting those with a shared fear of dementia. As participants plant and harvest, staff observe their progress and help them find a positive way forward through meaningful outdoor activity.

title: Satoyama Kitchen Fall
subTitle: Grandpa Makoto and Grandma Nobuko embrace the colours of autumn by making a seasonal chestnut sweet called kuri-yose.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Biz Stream Special Edition
subTitle: Explores innovative storage-based business models in Japan, from unique hotels to multipurpose lockers.

title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords: Famous Masterpieces
subTitle: Japanese swords, admired since ancient times for their beauty, are amazing works of art in their own right. This time, a look at one of the five greatest swords under heaven: Mikazuki Munechika.

title: Journeys in Japan
subTitle: Sheila Cliffe explores a variety of Japanese gardens in Shimane Prefecture to experience the subtle beauty and spiritual richness of the culture.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: My Street Piano
subTitle: In Shibuya, one of Tokyo's largest districts, a piano near a station ticket gate draws passers-by. People often stop to play, filling the air with heartfelt melodies.

title: Dining with the Chef
subTitle: Chef Rika presents the easy-to-follow recipes of chicken thigh karaage, chicken breast and daikon soup.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
subTitle: Performers dress as monsters called namahage on New Year's Eve as a part of a good-natured tradition that strengthens family and community bonds. The tradition has also been revived in the village of Tayazawa.

title: Herbal Symphony
subTitle: Explores Nara's herb scene by visiting Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden in summer, where the herbs are in full bloom.

title: Document 72 Hours
subTitle: Paying a visit to Yomotsu Hirasaka in Shimane Prefecture. It's a place linked to the underworld, referenced in Japanese mythology. For three days, conversations with those drawn to this special place.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: NHK World-Japan Special Program
subTitle: The latest news updates, current affairs, and documentaries on significant matters, focusing on Japan and Asia.

title: One in Every Japanese
subTitle: One in ten Japanese got married through online spouse-hunting services in 2020. Interviewing women who use matchmaking apps, including Manami, who uses multiple apps to find a perfect partner.

title: Medical Frontiers
subTitle: A Japanese research team, focusing on the fact that people briefly wake up multiple times during sleep, help develop a device to prevent insomnia.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: NHK World-Japan Special Program
subTitle: The latest news updates, current affairs, and documentaries on significant matters, focusing on Japan and Asia.

title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords: Famous Masterpieces
subTitle: Japanese swords, admired since ancient times for their beauty, are amazing works of art. This time, a look at a perfect distillation of craftsmanship: Gunchomon Hyogo-gusari no Tachi.

title: Deeper Look
subTitle: How should Japan and the US shape their strategies toward China and other Asian countries? Sheila A. Smith, CFR Senior Fellow, breaks down the strategic choices.

title: Dig More Japan!
subTitle: Whether it's mum's home cooking or a long-kept family recipe, every household has a taste of its own. We dig a little deeper.

title: Dining with the Chef Mini
subTitle: Learning about Japanese home cooking with Master Chef Saito, based on traditional Japanese cooking techniques in five minutes bite-sized segments. This time, beef with kombu dashi sauce.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: Cinematic Journey
subTitle: Daniel Moore explores Nagano, a mountainous region with a rich cultural heritage. He's captivated by the stunning winter landscape of its northern area.

title: Ramen Japan
subTitle: Taking a look at Niigata's Sanjo City which is considered by many to be the birthplace of curry ramen. A metalworking city, it also produces a vast array of different ramen utensils.

title: Journeys in Japan
subTitle: Sheila Cliffe explores a variety of Japanese gardens in Shimane Prefecture to experience the subtle beauty and spiritual richness of the culture.

title: BOSAI: Science That Can Save Your Life
subTitle: Explores disaster training advancements using digital technology, such as AR and VR. These tools provide realistic simulations of fire smoke and tsunami risks to improve emergency preparation and hazard awareness.

subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
subTitle: Featuring the now-defunct Tomioka Sill Mill, a world heritage site that was once used to mass produce raw silk that Japan exported worldwide in the 19th century.

title: On the Wings
subTitle: Introduces a special takeoff and landing footage from the cockpit of the flight from Haneda to New Chitose and techniques for dealing with various kinds of passengers.

subTitle: A Japanese research team, focusing on the fact that people briefly wake up multiple times during sleep, help develop a device to prevent insomnia.

title: Nun's Seasonal Calendar
subTitle: We learn about the autumn dates of kanro and soko. The nuns pick up chestnuts and cook gammodoki on the day of kanro. They then prepare mochi rice with homemade miso.

subTitle: Ishigami Junya, Austrian Frederick Kiesler Prize for Architecture and the Arts winner, talks about his innovative projects and reflects on the significance of architectural design.

subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
subTitle: A week into the new year, giant torches are lit in a shrine precinct. The shadows they create enable a demon to go to a river and cleanse people of troubles. This is Oniyo, the night of the oni.

title: Herbal Symphony
subTitle: Explores Nara's herb scene in autumn, the harvest season, through a visit to Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden.

title: Frontrunners
subTitle: Hayase Kumi was the first deaf Japanese to earn a pharmacist's license. She is also a cyclist competing in the Deaflympics - an international sports competition for deaf athletes.

subTitle: The historic figure of Minamoto no Yoshitsune has been immortalised in many kabuki plays as a child, a skilled warrior, and a tragic hero. Explore with actor Kataoka Ainosuke.

subTitle: Kyle Card hikes the newly designated long trail around majestic Mt. Fuji and discovers its secrets.

title: Ramen Japan
subTitle: A look at two differing local takes on ramen the food that that kept Hiroshima fed during postwar reconstruction, featuring a variety of flavours that have been passed down for generations.

title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo
subTitle: Gobo, or burdock root, may look like a piece of wood, but it is actually one of the most popular vegetables in Japan. Rich in dietary fibre, this root is said to improve both health and appearance.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
subTitle: Explores the birthplace of Shintoism, Okinoshima Island, and reveals how restricted public access helps in preserving the valuable artefacts found in the area.

title: On the Wings
subTitle: Witnesses the virtual excursion from an airplane and takes a look at the wonderful view during the flight to Fukuoka from an airplane window.

title: Dive in Tokyo
subTitle: Explores a world of playful fabric designs, from bold patterns and vivid colours to modern takes on traditional cloth.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: My Street Piano
subTitle: Hirosaki City in Aomori Prefecture is known for its Western architecture. A piano is placed inside the station, and people stop to play from their heart.

title: Kabuki Kool
subTitle: The historic figure of Minamoto no Yoshitsune has been immortalised in many kabuki plays as a child, a skilled warrior, and a tragic hero. Explore with actor Kataoka Ainosuke.

title: NHK Newsline
subTitle: Hourly news updates featuring current affairs, business news, financial updates and global weather forecasts.

title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
subTitle: A week into the new year, giant torches are lit in a shrine precinct. The shadows they create enable a demon to go to a river and cleanse people of troubles. This is Oniyo, the night of the oni.

title: Herbal Symphony
subTitle: Explores Nara's herb scene in autumn, the harvest season, through a visit to Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden.

title: Direct Talk
subTitle: Direct and in-depth. Interviews exploring the minds and motivations of the leaders, visionaries, artists and entrepreneurs who are changing our world.

title: Japan's Top Inventions
subTitle: Explores the stories behind innovative Japanese automated ginjo koji makers and the intricate sake brewing process, showing how modern precision supports traditional craftsmanship.

title: Newsroom Tokyo
subTitle: Comprehensive coverage of events in Japan and Asia. It explains the day's developments and what is behind them.

title: Biz Stream Special Edition
subTitle: From mushroom waste-eating beetles to an anti-reflective film based on the properties of a moth's eye, featuring insect-inspired business ideas.

title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords: Famous Masterpieces
subTitle: Japanese swords, admired since ancient times for their beauty, are amazing works of art. This time, a look a Yasutsuna, or Onikirimaru, a blade that was used to defeat a terrible demon.

title: Direct Talk
subTitle: Yoca Muta, a world-renowned artist known for her vibrant take on the traditional Kutani-yaki ceramic style, talks about her international success and how she creates art that breaks from tradition.

subTitle: Yoca Muta, a world-renowned artist known for her vibrant take on the traditional Kutani-yaki ceramic style, talks about her international success and how she creates art that breaks from tradition.

title: Century Signboards
subTitle: Explores Japan's oldest establishments that have survived and thrived for over 100 years. Behind them are stories of hardships and a skilful blend of tradition and innovation.

title: NHK World Japan
subTitle: At dusk in summer, a woman is absorbed in reading a letter. This chic lady is actually an advertisement model for Mitsui Echigoya, one of the top kimono fabric stores in Edo.

title: Biz Stream
subTitle: Rehab Reimagined: From home-made activities to interactive digital technology, this episode focuses on different approaches to physical therapy.

title: Frontrunners
subTitle: Hayase Kumi was the first deaf Japanese to earn a pharmacist's license. She is also a cyclist competing in the Deaflympics - an international sports competition for deaf athletes.

title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan

subTitle: The story of Uesugi Yozan, a feudal lord who was admired by President John F Kennedy and took over the Yonezawa Domain at the age of 15. He enacted financial reforms that led the destitute domain to a miraculous recovery.

subTitle: One in two do not drink in Japan, where intense social drinking is normal. Through interviews of drinkers and non-drinkers, hearing both sides, including a couple who went sober and opened a no-alcohol bar.
